intro: Crambe corvini, commonly known as the purple cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. It is native to Europe and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with alternate, pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are usually violet or purple, blooming in clusters at the ends of the stems. Crambe corvini is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes cultivated as a green manure crop.
